channel.title: ~~omfg pls help me~~
channel.description:
okay for about 2weeks ive been in this stupid situation. i when i log in using my server ip (jo-scape.no-ip.biz) i get on for a sec then i loose connection, you cant see urself, you have 0hp to start with, u cant move, and i can only login using local host (127.0.0.1) and my firneds cant get on using local host. so i need to find the solution to this thing. i have java and it runs okay and my friend had the same source and it workd perfectly with dragonscape 525 client. also i have a DI 524 router i looked up some pertforward guides and mabe i did it wrong but i am really really tired of this crap not working if anyone can help me ill give u anything u want on the server and its a 525 server pls help me anyone and if u got skype and u can help then add me im Rs_jo1006 and as a friend invitation type "from-smf" so ill add u okay? thx i hope this is the post that get answered because literaly i made about 10 of these types of posts and im getting pretty pissed because no one was able to help. if u need anymore inforkmation just reply to this topic or add me on skype or message me on the forums thank you and i appreciate everyone taht helps
-Jo62900

item.title: ~~omfg pls help me~~
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

[quote=“Scape-JAVA, post:21, topic:307177”][quote author=GrimReapersScythe link=topic=403304.msg2987970#msg2987970 date=1255131534]

www.portforward.com it’s a site about portforwarding, find your model then read about it and find out how to portforward it, simple as that.

If you would have read the entire topic, I’ve already given him a link directly to his router, and he’s tried it twice. It’s not working for him.

Jo, I suggest lending someone your files, to see if they can get people on it. If they can’t, the files are messed up. If they can, it’s your router, or you portfowarded wrong.

Actually i’ve read this topic twice, and portforward.com does help you alot, Jo try finding what port your server is, if it’s a different port then 43594, thats why.

also try downloading the portforward.com portchecker, just search it on google.

Instead of downloading programs to check your ports, just go in server.java in you server files, and search for: public static int serverlistenerPort =
The will be some numbers after the equals sign, make sure you portfowarded those exact numbers.
[/quote]

werid i wouldn’t usually say this but listen to this dude it’s 100% simplier.[/quote]

Yeah. A lot easier than downloading something that takes up space, when you can just look at a few numbers.

Read full topic

item.title: ~~omfg pls help me~~
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

It will disconnect you, because you’re hosting. The hoster always logs in using localhost. You need to make exceptions in your firewall, make sure you portfowarded correctly, and make sure you have the ports enabled. Then, give someone your client, and ip, and let them log in.

Read full topic
